ns5:Criterion.Name: Certificates by independent bodies about quality assurance standards
ns5:Criterion.Description: Will the economic operator be able to produce certificates drawn up by independent bodies attesting that the economic operator complies with the required quality assurance standards, including accessibility for disabled persons?

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: If not, please explain why and specify which other means of proof concerning the quality assurance scheme can be provided:

ns5:Criterion.Name: Technical facilities and measures for ensuring quality
ns5:Criterion.Description: It uses the following technical facilities and measures for ensuring quality and its study and research facilities are as follows:

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Guilty of misinterpretation, withheld information, unable to provide required documents and obtained confidential information of this procedure
ns5:Criterion.Description: Can the economic operator confirm the four exclusion grounds, that it has not been guilty of serious misrepresentation in supplying the information required for the verification of the absence of grounds for exclusion or the fulfilment of the selection criteria, that it has not withheld such information, it has been able, without delay, to submit the supporting documents required by a contracting authority or contracting entity, and it has not undertaken to unduly influence the decision making process of the contracting authority or contracting entity, to obtain confidential information that may confer upon it undue advantages in the procurement procedure or to negligently provide misleading information that may have a material influence on decisions concerning exclusion, selection or award?

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: For supply contracts: performance of deliveries of the specified type
ns5:Criterion.Description: For public supply contracts only: During the reference period, the economic operator has delivered the following principal deliveries of the type specified. Contracting authorities may require up to three years and allow experience dating from more than three years.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Allowance of checks
ns5:Criterion.Description: For complex products or services to be supplied or, exceptionally, for products or services which are required for a special purpose: The economic operator will allow checks to be conducted on the production capacities or the technical capacity of the economic operator and, where necessary, on the means of study and research which are available to it and on the quality control measures? The check is to be performed by the contracting authority or, in case the latter consents to this, on its behalf by a competent official body of the country in which the supplier or service provider is established.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Arrangement with creditors
ns5:Criterion.Description: Is the economic operator in arrangement with creditors? This information needs not be given if exclusion of economic operators in this case has been made mandatory under the applicable national law without any possibility of derogation where the economic operator is nevertheless able to perform the contract.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: Indicate reasons for being nevertheless to perform the contract

ns5:Criterion.Name: Subcontracting third parties
ns5:Criterion.Description: Does the economic operator intend to subcontract any share of the contract to third parties?

ns5:Requirement.Description: If yes and in so far as known, please list the proposed subcontractors:

ns5:Criterion.Name: Purely national exclusion grounds
ns5:Criterion.Description: Other exclusion grounds that may be foreseen in the national legislation of the contracting authority’s or contracting entity’s Member State. Do the purely national grounds of exclusion, which are specified in the relevant notice or in the procurement documents, apply?

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: Have you taken measures to demonstrate your reliability ("Self-Cleaning")?

ns5:Criterion.Name: Environmental management measures
ns5:Criterion.Description: The economic operator will be able to apply the following environmental management measures when performing the contract:

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: For supply contracts: samples, descriptions or photographs without certification of authenticity
ns5:Criterion.Description: For public supply contracts: The economic operator will supply the required samples, descriptions or photographs of the products to be supplied, which do not need to be accompanied by certifications of authenticity.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Analogous situation like bankruptcy under national law
ns5:Criterion.Description: Is the economic operator in any analogous situation like bankruptcy arising from a similar procedure under national laws and regulations? This information needs not be given if exclusion of economic operators in this case has been made mandatory under the applicable national law without any possibility of derogation where the economic operator is nevertheless able to perform the contract.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: Indicate reasons for being nevertheless to perform the contract

ns5:Criterion.Name: For service contracts: membership of particular organisation needed
ns5:Criterion.Description: Is a particular membership of a particular organisation needed in order to be able to perform the service in question in the country of establishment of the economic operator?

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Participation in a criminal organisation
ns5:Criterion.Description: Has the economic operator itself or any person who is a member of its administrative, management or supervisory body or has powers of representation, decision or control therein been the subject of a conviction by final judgment for participation in a criminal organisation, by a conviction rendered at the most five years ago or in which an exclusion period set out directly in the conviction continues to be applicable? As defined in Article 2 of Council Framework Decision 2008/841/JHA of 24 October 2008 on the fight against organised crime (OJ L 300, 11.11.2008, p. 42).

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: Length of the period of exclusion
Have you taken measures to demonstrate your reliability ("Self-Cleaning")?

ns5:Criterion.Name: Fraud
ns5:Criterion.Description: Has the economic operator itself or any person who is a member of its administrative, management or supervisory body or has powers of representation, decision or control therein been the subject of a conviction by final judgment for fraud, by a conviction rendered at the most five years ago or in which an exclusion period set out directly in the conviction continues to be applicable? Within the meaning of Article 1 of the Convention on the protection of the European Communities' financial interests (OJ C 316, 27.11.1995, p. 48).

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: Length of the period of exclusion
Have you taken measures to demonstrate your reliability ("Self-Cleaning")?

ns5:Criterion.Name: Technicians or technical bodies for quality control
ns5:Criterion.Description: It can call upon the following technicians or technical bodies, especially those responsible for quality control. For technicians or technical bodies not belonging directly to the economic operator's undertaking but on whose capacities the economic operator relies as set out under Part II, Section C, separate ESPD forms must be filled in.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Money laundering or terrorist financing
ns5:Criterion.Description: Has the economic operator itself or any person who is a member of its administrative, management or supervisory body or has powers of representation, decision or control therein been the subject of a conviction by final judgment for money laundering or terrorist financing, by a conviction rendered at the most five years ago or in which an exclusion period set out directly in the conviction continues to be applicable? As defined in Article 1 of Directive 2005/60/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 October 2005 on the prevention of the use of the financial system for the purpose of money laundering and terrorist financing (OJ L 309, 25.11.2005, p. 15).

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: Length of the period of exclusion
Have you taken measures to demonstrate your reliability ("Self-Cleaning")?

ns5:Criterion.Name: Direct or indirect involvement in the preparation of this procurement procedure
ns5:Criterion.Description: Has the economic operator or an undertaking related to it advised the contracting authority or contracting entity or otherwise been involved in the preparation of the procurement procedure?

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Average yearly turnover
ns5:Criterion.Description: Its average yearly turnover for the number of years required in the relevant notice, the procurement documents or the ESPD is as follows:

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: General yearly turnover
ns5:Criterion.Description: Its general yearly turnover for the number of financial years required in the relevant notice, the procurement documents or the ESPD is as follows:

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Assets being administered by liquidator
ns5:Criterion.Description: Are the assets of the economic operator being administered by a liquidator or by the court? This information needs not be given if exclusion of economic operators in this case has been made mandatory under the applicable national law without any possibility of derogation where the economic operator is nevertheless able to perform the contract.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: Indicate reasons for being nevertheless to perform the contract

ns5:Criterion.Name: It meets the objective and non discriminatory criteria or rules to be applied in order to limit the number of candidates in the following way: In case certain certificates or other forms of documentary evidence are required, please indicate for each whether the economic operator has the required documents:
ns5:Criterion.Description: If some of these certificates or forms of documentary evidence are available electronically, please indicate for each:

ns5:Criterion.Name: Breaching of obligations in the fields of environmental law
ns5:Criterion.Description: Has the economic operator, to its knowledge, breached its obligations in the fields of environmental law? As referred to for the purposes of this procurement in national law, in the relevant notice or the procurement documents or in Article 18(2) of Directive 2014/24/EU.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: Have you taken measures to demonstrate your reliability ("Self-Cleaning")?

ns5:Criterion.Name: Subcontracting proportion
ns5:Criterion.Description: The economic operator intends possibly to subcontract the following proportion (i.e. percentage) of the contract. Please note that if the economic operator has decided to subcontract a part of the contract and relies on the subcontractor’s capacities to perform that part, then please fill in a separate ESPD for such subcontractors, see Part II, Section C above.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Study and research facilities
ns5:Criterion.Description: It uses the following study and research facilities are as follows:

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Procurement reserved
ns5:Criterion.Description: Only in case the procurement is reserved: is the economic operator a sheltered workshop, a 'social business' or will it provide for the performance of the contract in the context of sheltered employment programmes?

ns5:Requirement.Description: What is the corresponding percentage of disabled or disadvantaged workers?
If required, please provide details on whether the employees concerned belong to a specific category of disabled or disadvantaged workers?

ns5:Criterion.Name: For service contracts: performance of services of the specified type
ns5:Criterion.Description: For public service contracts only: During the reference period, the economic operator has provided the following main services of the type specified. Contracting authorities may require up to three years and allow experience dating from more than three years.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Professional risk indemnity insurance
ns5:Criterion.Description: The insured amount in its professional risk indemnity insurance is the following:

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Agreements with other economic operators aimed at distorting competition
ns5:Criterion.Description: Has the economic operator entered into agreements with other economic operators aimed at distorting competition?

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: Have you taken measures to demonstrate your reliability ("Self-Cleaning")?

ns5:Criterion.Name: Early termination, damages or other comparable sanctions
ns5:Criterion.Description: Has the economic operator experienced that a prior public contract, a prior contract with a contracting entity or a prior concession contract was terminated early, or that damages or other comparable sanctions were imposed in connection with that prior contract?

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: Have you taken measures to demonstrate your reliability ("Self-Cleaning")?

ns5:Criterion.Name: For service contracts: authorisation of particular organisation needed
ns5:Criterion.Description: Is a particular membership of a particular organisation needed in order to be able to perform the service in question in the country of establishment of the economic operator?

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: EO relies capacities
ns5:Criterion.Description: Does the economic operator rely on the capacities of other entities in order to meet the selection criteria set out under Part IV and the criteria and rules (if any) set out under Part V below?

ns5:Criterion.Name: Terrorist offences or offences linked to terrorist activities
ns5:Criterion.Description: Has the economic operator itself or any person who is a member of its administrative, management or supervisory body or has powers of representation, decision or control therein been the subject of a conviction by final judgment for terrorist offences or offences linked to terrorist activities, by a conviction rendered at the most five years ago or in which an exclusion period set out directly in the conviction continues to be applicable? As defined in Articles 1 and 3 of Council Framework Decision of 13 June 2002 on combating terrorism (OJ L 164, 22.6.2002, p. 3). This exclusion ground also includes inciting or aiding or abetting or attempting to commit an offence, as referred to in Article 4 of that Framework Decision.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: Length of the period of exclusion
Have you taken measures to demonstrate your reliability ("Self-Cleaning")?

ns5:Criterion.Name: Number of managerial staff
ns5:Criterion.Description: The economic operator’s number of managerial staff for the last three years were as follows:

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Payment of taxes
ns5:Criterion.Description: Has the economic operator breached its obligations relating to the payment of taxes, both in the country in which it is established and in Member State of the contracting authority or contracting entity if other than the country of establishment?

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: Has this breach of obligations been established by means other than a judicial or administrative decision?
Please describe which means were used
If this breach of obligations was established through a judicial or administrative decision, was this decision final and binding?
Length of the period of exclusion

Has the economic operator fulfilled its obligations by paying or entering into a binding arrangement with a view to paying the taxes or social security contributions due, including, where applicable, any interest accrued or fines?

ns5:Criterion.Name: Set up of economic operator
ns5:Criterion.Description: In case the information concerning turnover (general or specific) is not available for the entire period required, please state the date on which the economic operator was set up or started trading:

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: For supply contracts: samples, descriptions or photographs with certification of authenticity
ns5:Criterion.Description: For public supply contracts: The economic operator will supply the required samples, descriptions or photographs of the products to be supplied and will provide certifications of authenticity where applicable.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: For supply contracts: certificates by quality control institutes
ns5:Criterion.Description: Can the economic operator provide the required certificates drawn up by official quality control institutes or agencies of recognised competence attesting the conformity of products clearly identified by references to the technical specifications or standards, which are set out in the relevant notice or the procurement documents?

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: If not, please explain why and state which other means of proof can be provided:

ns5:Criterion.Name: Average annual manpower
ns5:Criterion.Description: The economic operator’s average annual manpower for the last three years were as follows:

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Guilty of grave professional misconduct
ns5:Criterion.Description: Is the economic operator guilty of grave professional misconduct? Where applicable, see definitions in national law, the relevant notice or the procurement documents.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: Have you taken measures to demonstrate your reliability ("Self-Cleaning")?

ns5:Criterion.Name: Enrolment in a trade register
ns5:Criterion.Description: It is enrolled in trade registers kept in the Member State of its establishment as described in Annex XI of Directive 2014/24/EU; economic operators from certain Member States may have to comply with other requirements set out in that Annex.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: For works contracts: technicians or technical bodies to carry out the work
ns5:Criterion.Description: In the case of public works contracts, the economic operator will be able to call on the following technicians or technical bodies to carry out the work:

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Payment of social security contributions
ns5:Criterion.Description: Has the economic operator breached its obligations relating to the payment social security contributions, both in the country in which it is established and in Member State of the contracting authority or contracting entity if other than the country of establishment?

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: Has this breach of obligations been established by means other than a judicial or administrative decision?
Please describe which means were used
If this breach of obligations was established through a judicial or administrative decision, was this decision final and binding?
Length of the period of exclusion

Has the economic operator fulfilled its obligations by paying or entering into a binding arrangement with a view to paying the taxes or social security contributions due, including, where applicable, any interest accrued or fines?

ns5:Criterion.Name: EO participating in procurement procedure
ns5:Criterion.Description: Is the economic operator participating in the procurement procedure together with others?

ns5:Requirement.Description: a) Please indicate the role of the economic operator in the group (leader, responsible for specific tasks...):
b) Please identify the other economic operators participating in the procurement procedure together:
c) Where applicable, name of the participating group:

ns5:Criterion.Name: For works contracts: performance of works of the specified type
ns5:Criterion.Description: For public works contracts only: During the reference period, the economic operator has performed the following works of the specified type. Contracting authorities may require up to five years and allow experience dating from more than five years.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Supply chain management
ns5:Criterion.Description: It will be able to apply the following supply chain management and tracking systems when performing the contract:

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Business activities are suspended
ns5:Criterion.Description: Are the business activities of the economic operator suspended? This information needs not be given if exclusion of economic operators in this case has been made mandatory under the applicable national law without any possibility of derogation where the economic operator is nevertheless able to perform the contract.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: Indicate reasons for being nevertheless to perform the contract

ns5:Criterion.Name: Tools, plant or technical equipment
ns5:Criterion.Description: The following tools, plant or technical equipment will be available to it for performing the contract:

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Insolvency
ns5:Criterion.Description: Is the economic operator the subject of insolvency or winding-up? This information needs not be given if exclusion of economic operators in this case has been made mandatory under the applicable national law without any possibility of derogation where the economic operator is nevertheless able to perform the contract.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: Indicate reasons for being nevertheless to perform the contract

ns5:Criterion.Name: All selection criteria will be satisfied
ns5:Criterion.Description: It satisfies all the required selection criteria indicated in the relevant notice or in the procurement documents referred to in the notice.

ns5:Criterion.Name: Other economic or financial requirements
ns5:Criterion.Description: Concerning the other economic or financial requirements, if any, that may have been specified in the relevant notice or the procurement documents, the economic operator declares that:

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: EO registered
ns5:Criterion.Description: If applicable, is the economic operator registered on an official list of approved economic operators or does it have an equivalent certificate (e.g. under a national (pre)qualification system)?

ns5:Requirement.Description: a) Please provide the relevant registration or certification number, if applicable:
b) If the certificate of registration or certification is available electronically, please state:
c) Please state the references on which the registration or certification is based, and, where applicable, the classification obtained in the official list:
d) Does the registration or certification cover all of the required selection criteria?

e) Will the economic operator be able to provide a certificate with regard to the payment of social security contributions and taxes or provide information enabling the contracting authority or contracting entity to obtaining it directly by accessing a national database in any Member State that is available free of charge?
If the relevant documentation is available electronically, please indicate:

ns5:Criterion.Name: Corruption
ns5:Criterion.Description: Has the economic operator itself or any person who is a member of its administrative, management or supervisory body or has powers of representation, decision or control therein been the subject of a conviction by final judgment for corruption, by a conviction rendered at the most five years ago or in which an exclusion period set out directly in the conviction continues to be applicable? As defined in Article 3 of the Convention on the fight against corruption involving officials of the European Communities or officials of Member States of the European Union, OJ C 195, 25.6.1997, p. 1, and in Article 2(1) of Council Framework Decision 2003/568/JHA of 22 July 2003 on combating corruption in the private sector (OJ L 192, 31.7.2003, p. 54). This exclusion ground also includes corruption as defined in the national law of the contracting authority (contracting entity) or the economic operator.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: Length of the period of exclusion
Have you taken measures to demonstrate your reliability ("Self-Cleaning")?

ns5:Criterion.Name: Specific average turnover
ns5:Criterion.Description: Its specific average yearly turnover in the business area covered by the contract for the number of years required in the relevant notice, the procurement documents or the ESPD is as follows:

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Breaching of obligations in the fields of labour law
ns5:Criterion.Description: Has the economic operator, to its knowledge, breached its obligations in the fields of labour law? As referred to for the purposes of this procurement in national law, in the relevant notice or the procurement documents or in Article 18(2) of Directive 2014/24/EU.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: Have you taken measures to demonstrate your reliability ("Self-Cleaning")?

ns5:Criterion.Name: Certificates by independent bodies about environmental management systems or standards
ns5:Criterion.Description: Will the economic operator be able to produce certificates drawn up by independent bodies attesting that the economic operator complies with the required environmental management systems or standards?

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: If not, please explain why and specify which other means of proof concerning the environmental management systems or standards can be provided:

ns5:Criterion.Name: Enrolment in a relevant professional register
ns5:Criterion.Description: It is enrolled in relevant professional registers kept in the Member State of its establishment as described in Annex XI of Directive 2014/24/EU; economic operators from certain Member States may have to comply with other requirements set out in that Annex.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Breaching of obligations in the fields of social law
ns5:Criterion.Description: Has the economic operator, to its knowledge, breached its obligations in the fields of social law? As referred to for the purposes of this procurement in national law, in the relevant notice or the procurement documents or in Article 18(2) of Directive 2014/24/EU.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: Have you taken measures to demonstrate your reliability ("Self-Cleaning")?

ns5:Criterion.Name: Financial ratio
ns5:Criterion.Description: Concerning the financial ratios specified in the relevant notice, the procurement documents or the ESPD, the economic operator declares that the actual values for the required ratios are as follows:

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Conflict of interest due to its participation in the procurement procedure
ns5:Criterion.Description: Is the economic operator aware of any conflict of interest, as indicated in national law, the relevant notice or the procurement documents due to its participation in the procurement procedure?

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Educational and professional qualifications
ns5:Criterion.Description: The following educational and professional qualifications are held by the service provider or the contractor itself, and/or (depending on the requirements set out in the relevant notice or the procurement documents by its managerial staff.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Bankruptcy
ns5:Criterion.Description: Is the economic operator bankrupt? This information needs not be given if exclusion of economic operators in this case has been made mandatory under the applicable national law without any possibility of derogation where the economic operator is nevertheless able to perform the contract.

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: Indicate reasons for being nevertheless to perform the contract

ns5:Criterion.Name: Specific yearly turnover
ns5:Criterion.Description: Its specific yearly turnover in the business area covered by the contract for the number of financial years required in the relevant notice, the procurement documents or the ESPD is as follows:

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Criterion.Name: Child labour and other forms of trafficking in human beings
ns5:Criterion.Description: Has the economic operator itself or any person who is a member of its administrative, management or supervisory body or has powers of representation, decision or control therein been the subject of a conviction by final judgment for child labour and other forms of trafficking in human beings, by a conviction rendered at the most five years ago or in which an exclusion period set out directly in the conviction continues to be applicable? As defined in Article 2 of Directive 2011/36/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 5 April 2011 on preventing and combating trafficking in human beings and protecting its victims, and replacing Council Framework Decision 2002/629/JHA (OJ L 101, 15.4.2011, p. 1).

ns5:LegislationReference.ns4:Title: Public Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU
ns5:LegislationReference.Description: Directive 2014/24/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement and repealing Directive 2004/18/EC

ns5:Requirement.Description: Length of the period of exclusion
Have you taken measures to demonstrate your reliability ("Self-Cleaning")?
